form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cornyn (for himself, Mr. Banks, Mr. Crapo, Mr. Daines, Mr. Ricketts, Mr. Risch, Mr. Scott of South Carolina, Mr. Tuberville, Mr. Justice, Mr. Tillis, Mrs. Blackburn, and Mr. Hagerty) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, by adding an additional aggravating factor to be considered in determining whether a sentence of death is warranted.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Justice for American Victims of Illegal Aliens Act.
Section 3592(c) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by inserting after paragraph (16) the following:

subparagraph.text: came to, entered, or remains in the United States in violation of Federal law; and
has been convicted of killing, attempting to kill, or conspiring to kill a United States citizen.
